lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 11, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 11** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

3. After that, locate the `src/main/java/duke.Duke.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run duke.Duke.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:
* @param name set the name of the deadline
System.out.println("Hello, I am your chatbot!\nMy name is " + name + "\nHow may I help?");

assertEquals(expected, result, "Event display test (not done) failed: incorrect result");
String expected = "[E][X] Party (From: Aug 30 2023 To: Sep 01 2023)";
assertEquals(expected, result, "Event display test (done) failed: incorrect result");
String expected = "[E][X] Meeting (From: Dec 15 2023 To: Dec 20 2023)";
assertEquals(expected, result, "Event display test (different date format) failed: incorrect result");
String expected = "[E][] Workshop (From: Nov 05 2023 To: Nov 07 2023)";
assertEquals(expected, result, "Event display test failed: incorrect result");
assertEquals(4, result, "Mark pattern test failed: incorrect result");
assertEquals(9, result, "Mark pattern test failed: incorrect result");
assertEquals(-1, result, "Mark pattern test failed: incorrect result");
assertEquals(6, result, "Mark pattern test failed: incorrect result");
assertEquals(2, result, "Unmark pattern test failed: incorrect result");
assertEquals(7, result, "Unmark pattern test failed: incorrect result");
assertEquals(-1, result, "Unmark pattern test failed: incorrect result");
assertEquals(4, result, "Unmark pattern test failed: incorrect result");
assertEquals(1, result, "Delete pattern test failed: incorrect result");
assertEquals(6, result, "Delete pattern test failed: incorrect result");
assertEquals(-1, result, "Delete pattern test failed: incorrect result");
assertEquals(2, result, "Delete pattern test failed: incorrect result");
